intro: Luzuriaga timorensis, commonly known as the Timor snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant is typically found in high-altitude regions, growing in cool, moist environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
